body.p: Which is not a mechanism used to provide analgesia? Greek “ana” means “without” and “algos” means “pain”.

multiple_choice.choice: block propagation of action potential along peripheral neuron
block propagation of action potentials in the central nervous system
inhibit ability of nociceptor to respond to stimulus
block the production of nociceptor activating chemicals that are normally released after tissue damage

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is how most local topical (benzocaine) and injected anesthetics (novacaine) function.
Incorrect. This is how central nervous system anesthetics (ether, barbiturates, etc.) function.
Correct. Changing the nociceptor is not practical. It is much easier to either eliminate the source of the stimulus or interrupt the propagation of the signal.
Incorrect. This is how NSAIDs (pronounced en-saids) or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs function.
